concept-wr.title: Introduction to Regions
concept-wr.shortdesc: An OpenStack region is a discrete OpenStack system with its own set of resources and its own set of services. Typically, some services are shared with other OpenStack regions, notably the Keystone service. Other shared services may include Cinder and Glance.

conbody.p: Regions can be categorized into two types:

dd.p: In a Primary Region, all OpenStack services used by the region run locally. This type of region typically provides shared services to other regions.

In a Secondary Region, some OpenStack services used by the region run locally, while others run in another region. This type of region makes use of shared services, typically provided by the Primary Region.

section.title: Supported Multi-Region Configurations
section.p: Titanium Server supports several configurations for regions.

li.p: Titanium Server as Primary and Secondary Regions
provides a mechanism for scaling a Titanium Server Cloud beyond the limits of a single Titanium Server Cloud or Region
Third-Party OpenStack Cloud as Primary Region and Titanium Server as Secondary Region

provides a mechanism to extend an existing Third Party OpenStack Cloud with a Titanium Server Cloud, enabling users to incrementally add Titanium Server values such as High Availability and High Performance Networking to an existing cloud solution

note.p: Titanium Server CPE configurations are not supported as Primary or Secondary Regions.
